column12: Review
Whenever you need it, it needs to upgrade the bridge.

Location awareness/geofencing still doesn't work. Any time I enable it and leave the screen and come back, it shows as disabled again. Even if I go into the leaving and coming home interfaces, uncheck and recheck the boxes for the rooms I want this for, and click save, the location awareness toggle still flips back to off.  This has been a problem for months and I still typically use the gen 1 app because it is a little more reliable, but now they are prompting users in that app that it is no longer supported and should switch to this one. Well I switched to this one again and I have to say I still don't believe I'm actually using a supported app.
It's ok but yet the hue bridge doesn't connect
Can't connect outside of home WiFi anymore. Why??
It's a great App never had any problems  with this,only onwards and upwards.

When it works it is awesome. But most of the time it doesn't. Then there is the flickering. If you are in the app, and haven't told it to do anything, it can flicker. Nothing is consistent though. It didn't always work, and it doesn't always flicker.
OK start Philips but you can do much better here. E.g. Alarms should allow aight to be dimmed to a custom level...Then brighten from there.
The main app is OK but the widgets don't remember light state when using more than one bulb... useless

Simple, very easy to use, clean interface. My only complaint is that I wish you could phase on a particular light "manually" (like in the older Hue app), rather than turning it on then phasing it down. Beyond that, love this flexibility with lighting!
Gen 2 app is marginally better. Way more intuitive to use. Should have left as is, but just make it easier to adjust brightness

Latest hub firmware update messed more up than it fixed - also this app is useless compared to almost any other hue lighting app.  Why isn't it the best? It's the official app and you're Phillips - get programming and add features.  It's so limiting and restrictive.   Life your game.
Impenetrable guff.  Remains unrecognizable despite all gear installed, searched..... and unfound!
Needed some timers and more features
Amazing
I don't know why this is only 2.8 stars, it works fine for me!

Can't fault this app, set up lights very easily. Time (routines) you're lights very easily, and tested whilst on holiday and can control it without problems. Home tracking doesn't work as others have said, that's not an issue for me.  I'm only using white b22 & gu10 bulbs.
When you start a routine, why cant you set an end-time or offtime on it? And I would really appreciate if you could set it to follow the sunrise/sunset.
It's amazing. I love it !
App never wants to close
You had a "random switch" that let an alarm randomly activate within a 30min window in the old app. Please add it to the new one.
Leaving this at 1 star until they fix basic features, particularly geofencing. The fact that Philips remains silent on this broken app is infuriating.
Location awareness not woking.

Big Fail. Does not recognise it's own lamps without painfully entering serial numbers. Does not recognise GU10 RGB Lightify Bulbs at all, as dealer promised. 0 points for customer experience. The opposite of smooth.

awesome

Just gave up on the wemo system and came over to Hue. Wish I'd done it sooner. This system is much more reliable, easier to set up, and the colour effects are pretty cool. Could it be tweaked? Sure. For example, it would be great to combine multiple routines into one so you didn't have to reset them all to occur consecutively. But I'm very very happy with the system as is.

This causes the app to be caught in limbo, being logged in, but offline, without any option to logout. In 'Scenes' there are three presets, these can be altered, but the change is not saved. The 'Bright' scene is a bit too bright for me. Also it would be nice if I could add 'Routines' and other editorial things offline, which then syncs when I open the app at home.

Thats very helpful.  - several timer settings. - improvement of the reaction time of the app.   - Shortcut settings; individual for all defined rooms. Conclusion - brilliant app and a lot of improvements in comparison to the  disappointment of the  1st version of the app.

If this were the only app available for controlling Hue lights, it would be somewhat mediocre. Given that there are many different apps, all of which seem to specialize in different areas with no one single app providing EVERYTHING that you would want, this fits into the tool set usefully.  The Philips Hue app controls adding lights, naming them, assigning them to groups with relative ease. It handles updates to firmware and addition of accessories like the motion detector and dimmer switches more easily than other apps. It does *not* do color management or preset management well.   If you are listening, Philips, I would love to have better preset management and ways to set up triggers and animations, using your accessories. The motion detector desperately needs a way to set end time. Better integration with IFTTT too.  There are apps on iOS which do creative things like animations that no Android app seems to handle well. But overall, this is a fine basic app. I use it for simple things, quickly, and it is fine.

This is the first time I have ever left a review for a product.  But, I felt so strongly that I was compelled to write, as I hope if enough people complain Philips will take notice.  The app is useless.  I have to use a third party app (Hue Pro) to control my lights.  It is bad when an outsider does a better job at interacting with your product then your own app does.   I recently purchased a motion sensor to accompany to my lights.  However, I have to go through the official app to add it to my system, as I didn't see a way to do it in the 3rd-party app.  I am stuck in a never ending loop of "An Update Is Available for your Hue Bridge".  After watching it, rather unsuccessfully, look like it was partially installing the update, I get the message that an error occurred and to try again.  And not just once, but DOZENS of times. Just when it appears that all is not lost (and the app tells me that the update is successful), I click DONE and and it informs me that an update is available.  Hmmmm.  Weird, I just installed a freaking update like five times!!! Today!  And of course, there is no way to bypass this screen so that I can interact with my system. Conclusion: unless you love being frustrated, staring at the same screen over and over and have tons of time to waste, then you should find another app (like Hue Pro) to use for your bulbs.  Just know that adding accessories to your system is also going to be a pain.  If the app doesn't get better, I will never buy another bulb or accessory from Philips.   Isn't the point to make life easier?  Not make it infuriating.

Philips hue dimmer switch and motion sensor, not enough granular control.  When I manually activate the lights with the dimmer switch, or with the app, the motion sensor will override the dimmer switch/app and shut off the lights when it sees motion(after its preset interval).   Can the dimmer be set to override the motion sensor in the on position? This would make the system much better and stop me from having to manually disable the motion sensor every time I want to work in the garage or go in the back yard in the Hot tub.  ifttt style triggers for the dimmer switch would be great " IF dimmer switch ON pressed -THEN motion sensor disable. IF dimmer off pressed then motion sensor ENABLE  I understand not making the app too complicated, but add an advanced  user section.  The app is painfully buggy, and often has to be force quit to function again. After the recent light update, every one of my dimmer switches stopped functioning... had to manually re-pair every one of them :(  I have Philips hue all over my house and love them. It is just the small controls that are not present that make it frustrating and stop me from adding them to more parts of my house.

I found that the system works well with Alexa for voice control and setting up lighting routines was simple, no more timers. I tried using a motion sensor to control lighting for multiple rooms, but found it goofed routines, so I'm just using it for one room now. To sum it all up, Hue is working a little better than I expected.

column11: Take it out the back and put a bullet in it
column12: This is the worst piece of software I have ever tried to use, and coming from someone who has used iTunes, that's really saying something. The UI is one of the most unintuitive things ever, individual lights can't be listed in multiple "rooms" which means you can't group rooms and the geofencing is as buggy as anything I have ever seen. The Gen 1 app was pretty bad but this takes it to a whole new level of crappiness. It's a shame because the Hue hardware is awesome - it's just really let down by software.

I got a motion sensor. Using the ambient light sensor on the device. When the light sensor turns off the motion sensor, the light stays ON when the ambient light is satisfied. MAJOR FLAW, the lights stay on if the sensor goes inactive. If the sensor goes inactive while lights are on, it should send an off signal to the lights it is controlling.  Our lights were on all day even when the light sensor turned the device off and left all our lights ON.

Another problem comes with that "frozen widget" issue : the scenes are activated upon touching the corresponding icon but the "off" option doesn't appear anymore. Finally, unlike the first generation app, if you decide to remove the widget from your screen, the scenes you selected disappear from the widget settings page, which you can't even access from the app by the way !

column11: I like the old app better
column12: The old app is better in my opinion.
Latest update has fixed manufacturing of the technical issues. Have to say the UI is still confusing and not intuitive, but functionality is now great.
Very basic scheduling.  No random time window. Would be much better if it offered Calendar view similar to honeywell comfort connect or at least capability to sort routines by room, time or action.

I was most excited about the location awareness for the Home and away, however it doesn't seem to work. I turn on my location, and then it turns itself right back off. For the amount of money spent, I think this needs to be fixed. Other than that, the lights are very fun.

The app offers basically no chance to create custom scenes. The only way to edit one of the default scenes is to zoom in on a colour area, hit shuffle, and hope that the result will look nice. No way to import scenes from the previous version of the app. No way to manage groups of lights in the same room. And the list of missing features and regressions can go on. This app is a huge step backwards compared to the previous version. It's basically a tiny demo that shows some things the Philips Hue can do - playing with four default non-editable scenes, and hoping that somebody who invested a lot of money in Philips Hue lightbulbs, LED strips and friends will be happy with that. Luckily there's a lot of unofficial apps out there doing a better job, but I have no clue of how a serious company like Philips could tolerate such a shamefully low quality for their official app.

Why are they just thrown in a big pile? It would be extremely useful to stand on a room and only have routines which interacts with the room shown. column11: Won't retain blue or green user-selected colors
column12: The app is OK.  It gives you the ability to select the colour of light to shine using a screen with all the colors it supports.  However, it isn't saving any selected color in the lower half (green / blue) of the screen, unless it's very close to the light middle (almost white).  Try picking a deep blue, and it reverts your selection to a deep purple.  It does this with all 5 of my Gen 2 A19 bulbs.

By far the best free entry level Hue app out there with a growing set of quality features.  It is impossible to satisfy all levels of user with a single app. Granted the decision to remove previous features is questionable (i.e. the ability to add the same light to multiple groups).  This single app is going to be the first app a new Hue user will install. They might be a home automation expert who will be making requests in JSON directly to the bridge, but equally they might also be a retired couple who picked it up from a diy store.  The app is in continued development and new features are being added gradually. You can now switch scenes using the dimmer switch, and with 2.5 you can pick individual light colours from a photo (which seemed to be a major issue for people when they removed it)  Yes there are more sophisticated Hue apps out there, but there is also a sea of rubbish apps on the various stores (many of which are not free)

You can theoretically do that with IFTTT, but that doesn't work either; - there's no facility for lights to come on at random intervals for security purposes (I gather that was available in the older version of the app); - you have to set separate routines for "on" and "off" - why no facility to set lights on for a specified period? - there's no sleep timer (although the Go to Sleep routine works well).

column11: It's like the developers don't even own a Hue setup
column12: The app is intuitive enough to get the job done and look good doing it, but for some reason it doesn't have any way to group lights together and change their color outside of creating new scenes. Why this app is missing such a basic feature (which was included in the previous Hue app) boggles my mind. I can't believe that there is no way the developers of this app were using their own lights and never once thought it would be useful to be able to group them all and change all the lights' colors at once.

This terrible app apparently can only track one bulb instance to a single group -   how stupid is this!  In the old version I created multiple groups with the same bulbs for the sole purpose of changing colors on the fly.  Here's the killer - the original HUE app which supports same bulbs across multiple groups is NOT compatible with Android 7 / Nougat.  The one bulb one group seems to be very flat file oriented sw, while the original HUE app was relational where a bulb could be associated across multiple groups each with their own color assignments.  On the surface it appears the new app is simply CHEAP programing or maybe it's lazy programing - either way -  moving forward - Nougat and the HUE app is a non starter.  The new app turns HUE into over priced Christmas lights.  We have all seen this before - a great HW product - killed by a thoughtless cheap SW implementation.  Look to - HUE Pro it supports same bulb across multiple groups each with its own color assignment.  And it's compatible with Nougat!   Phillips innovation is simply lipstick on a pig

The new app loses far more function than it gains.

As good as the lights are is as bad as this app is. Very limited functionality beyond the basics. Timers are awful.  I had to resort to using IFTTT to get even the most basic timers running, such as on/off times based on sunrise or sunset. My episode year old x10 software had more flexibility! When a bridge update was available the app would not even let me control the lights until I let it install the update. It would not let me defer the update to a later time. JUNK APP!

The point of having smart lights is CONTROL. So it's daft that the new app gives you much less of it. You CAN create new scenes based on your own photos but you can't choose what colour to assign to which light manually - only shuffle all of the lights and colours and you can't set the brightness of individual lights within the scene. You CAN ascribe specific colours and brightness to specific lights but only from a single, predefined pallette. This is a mainstream interface for a very geek product. Stupid.

Away from home never ever works.

Why would you remove useful and fully functioning features to give even less control over an ever expanding lighting system? Defies logic. Let's not even mention all the bugs on the basic and new features you've added. Cannot believe you've managed to go backwards so much after making small but at least beneficial steps with the old version. Constant login issues, timers/alarms gone, night time routine pointless, can't use the same bulb in two setups to be creative. List continues I've run out of space...

column11: Should have just improved the original app
column12: This app seems to have filled in the gaps that the original app was missing and... that's it. It finally has the ability to group lights and more customisable widgets, but that's all that's improved. No ability to select which lights you want in a scene, which specific colour per bulb, and no ability to preset the brightness. Now the original app has had support pulled and it's already falling apart. Why were the new features and improved UI not just added to the original app?? Waste of my phone's memory.
I can't even use the app because it claims there's an update for my bridge but the bridge won't update. $100s of worthless lights! Works fine for my husband though

Looks pretty (compared to Gen1), but so much is still broken. There's no sleep mode... well, there is, but show me an adult who has a fixed "bedtime"!!!...reverted to Gen1 app. Phillips need to sort out their UX and feature set. Seriously debating Lifx for the new house now...
App unusable because a stupid update keeps failing.

Asked to sign in with every little thing.  No remote access while off home network.  Add ins such as nest often lose functionality.  Get it right!  Do a better job!  How this made it to GA is mind boggling.

column11: Still a long way to go!

OMG I can't believe they have broken this app. Now all of my scenes are gone that I spent so much time creating. Plus now it keeps asking me to login to My Hue even though I know I was just logged in. Very very disappointed and wish I could give this update negative stars.  Is it possible to go back to the old version?? These lights are amazing but the developers are making apps like they are COBOL programmers. Philips please fix this and get developers who know what they are doing.

Every time I want to open the app there is something new preventing me from doing what. I just added a new light it does not let me find it because it wants to update and keeps failing the update. Big failure Trying to minimize the application.
Can't log in to "My Hue" account.

Upon launching app I'm forced to do an update to the bridge, the update fails every time and I can't get past the update screen to use my lights. It worked briefly when I first installed, bit now the update is killing me

By far the worst app imaginable. I'm not sure who is making these app for Phillips but no thougnt in this at all. This literally kills the experience by not having a decent application to control your lights.
I know some people don't like the losing or hiding of some features, for what I use Hue for this is much better than the first app and is working really well for me. Many thanks!
Awesome app. Love the new updated version
Very disappointed, going back to previous app that allows for lights to be in multiple scenes

column11: Horrible app, lights only on one room, scenes buried.
column12: Really Phillips? Terrible. Can't select all lights in a room and set a color the same? Have to set the colors for each light, then create an uneditable scene.  Want to make a change, do it and save as a NEW scene. Scenes or Rooms should be optionally front and center. Oh, lights can only be in one room at a time. Why? What if I want scenes that are for one room or span many. Phillips needs to fix this abomination. Still broken.
The official app honestly sucks. You cannot make all of the lights change color at the same time or really anything cool. Use Hue Pro¬Æ it works a lot better.
Please add sunrise/sunset times with a modifier.  For example, 30 minutes before sunrise, turn off exterior lights.  Would eliminate manual adjustments.
This app updates tonight and the lights keep coming on whenever they want to? Time to unplug them if this keeps up all night!

column11: Sad. Keeps logging off, random time no longer available

column11: Good interface but frustrated with login

Please fix, happy to help where possible.
What a waste of time. Going to have to try another app. Or revert to the old one.
Absolutely love this new interface. Head & shoulders above previous version. GREAT FEATURES! Don't pay attention to negative posts. This is the real deal.

column11: Unable to login to my hue with Google two-factor authentication.

column11: Does not connect to the cloud

This app is great. Was in desperate need of work and they really did a wonderful job. Simple, beautiful and easy to use now.

column11: It's ok but NOT easy to use

Better!

column11: Hated the old app, love the new one.
column12: The poor reviews on this app had me worried about it, but after actually using the app it seems pretty great. It is certainly different from the old app, but it is superior in every way. A small learning curve is necessary for change, get over it people.

column11: Not as good as you'd expect

column11: Can't even log in to my hue!
column12: I didn't believe the other reviews till I tested it myself. First thing I go to do, Log in to My Hue and it seems you haven't tested the oAuth to Google for an account with 2FA activated. The oAuth flow you're using is inside a web view and doesn't support native oAuth like any Android app should! Even with the web view oAuth you have now, accounts with 2FA enabled get redirected to login screen and get stuck in an infinite loop! Unbelievable. Will consider re-rating once this is fixed.

column11: Worse than the original app, which itself was very bad

Randomly disappearing alarms.  Bizarre scene settings.  Less options.  All of these make the new app a serious step backward from the original app.
Update number two on the app. Still can't dim and save dimmed settings in my Scenes. Yet you can in the old app. Maybe the next update they'll include all the features the old app had!
Rolling back to old app

Nearly impossible to log into your account via Google+ if you have two factor authentication enabled. Can't access the sync with Nest interface. Not really sure why I have to do it again since I finally was able to jump through the flaming hoops to get my account authenticated in the time window of a valid 2FA token. Just a horrible horrible upgrade to new app experience.

All the updates seem cosmetic and the actions moved around, but nothing really got added... There is no longer a "timer", which I switched on going to bed, allowing the lights to gradually dim for however long I set. Now I have to create a new routine every night, set a time for it to start, etc... It's not a ton of time, but it's really better to just start a timer. Also, the scenes are dumbed down and buried. You can't control individual light colors, brightness, etc, you can only have it randomize.

column11: One step forward, two steps back
column12: Love the new layout of things. It really had potential, but the execution was terrible. I look forward to trying again after the next update.

column11: UI and light control improvements but buggy geofencing
column12: Hue Gen 2 app adds new features like the ability to organize lights by room, but old features like geofencing and logging into your Hue account are very buggy.

Seems like the 1st gen app is more functional than this. This one seems also buggy- I was having some odd issues logging into MyHue or visit any of the friends of hue apps links. EDIT: So I still don't understand why this needed to be a separate app, but after playing around with it a bit I do really like being able to setup rooms easily and the widget manager is TONS better. The primary things I miss are all my scenes I created from the 1st app (are now lost), and the interactive color picker.
Very buggy...
Can't find bridge. Useless.

column11: is this bad or is it very bad, no its worse
column12: on the tap you can turn on 4 lights per button but only turn off 3 lights per button, does not make sense. scenes now only cover 1 room not multiple rooms/lights. scenes are much more difficult to set up. wakeup was a waste of time used routines instead. turning on after sunset did not work because for some reason the app turned itself off. 1star is for leaving house which is nice extra. hue 1 was not brilliant but it worked well. 1 major  -ve is this app does not work on a tablet, WHY???
My geofencing doesn't work anymore. I turn it on but when I exit it it's back off. It won't save preferences.

Twice the size, half the features.  More responsive and visually cleaner interface, but poorly executed and lacks most of the functional features of the previous version.   Can't control lights individually to create a scene, and doesn't work well with lightstrips as it treats them the same as bulbs.
Big step backward from the first gen app.

Finally supports groups (rooms). BUT, in order to be usable in my house with approx. 40 lights and 10 hue tap, two essentials are missing: 1. Individual lights have to be able to belong to more than one room at the same time. 2. It must be possible to select multiple lights to set to a specific color; as it is now it is impossible to set two lights to the same color! EDIT: Spending more time with it, one realizes that very complex overlapping scenes are quite easy to realize using the app as is!

There's a new Hue app, I'm assuming just to get away from the terrible reviews of the old one. Unfortunately this one is awful too, lacking basic functionality that you have to go to a 3rd party app for. Even those are pretty limited by the Philips api. I've stopped buying Philips things based on my experience with these lights and other items. I'm looking forward to someone good doing a better job of smart bulbs.

I set a wake up routine and then it disappeared from the app. My lights turn on every morning and there is no way for me to stop it. If i make a new one it names it 2 so it knows there are others it is not displaying
this is lacking so many features its pathetic. what was so wrong with gen 1 that it needed a brand new app ???
With two factor enabled unable to login using Google plus

I initially rated this 2 stars as I thought they removed the option of color selection from a spectrum. Poking around in the app for a while revealed a color spectrum with a nice interface. It's not a powerful app, but it includes all the major features I care about, and with a greatly improved interface.

Some good ideas to improve upon the first app but very poor implementation. This app is expected to control some of the most expensive consumer lamps on the market, but fails miserably. Third party apps are still much better for controlling Hue lamps.
I never really understood how to use the old app correctly, this one just works smoothly and cleanly.

column11: Come on UX team, you should know better
column12: So the UI looks respectable now, but the user experience fell right off a cliff. It seems the team behind this update didn't do their homework to know what people actually want from the app and how they use the lighting system in their homes. The most important features have been buried or removed completely. You can't group lights to match colors in the same room anymore, and a dashboard for quick and easy custom scenes access is gone. It's prettier but totally dysfunctional. Hire a UX pro please.

This update is riddled with bugs. We have the entire house on Hue lighting and were running automated schedules all day for different times of day. Not only was it a total disaster reprogramming all of these bulbs, but the new ‚ÄúRoutines‚Äù function has a few issues. It misses bulbs frequently, is randomly activating the wrong scenes, and the fade feature is not saving. I also lost the option for a fade longer than 30 minutes, bummer. I really enjoyed an hour long fade between colors at night. Also, the all off function is not working when programmed into the Hue taps. Pretty aggravating experience for having spent $3500.00+ on light bulbs.

Philips wat jammer wat jullie met deze app hebben gedaan. De originele app was goed en had hooguit op een paar punten verbeterd kunnen worden, en nu vervangen jullie hem met een app die die niet werkbaar is. Los ervan dat hij niks importeert uit de oude app terwijl daar alles al helemaal goed staat, kan je in de nieuwe app niet eens een Scene normaal aanmaken met een eigen plaatje en lampen daarbij los instellen. The first gen was way better. Can I go back?

column11: Finally add rooms and now scenes are useless
column12: How rooms weren't included in the first app is beyond me (it's just an organizational concept). Now they've been added, but scenes are room specific so there's no easy way to control multiple rooms without creating meta-rooms. Scenes should either have no concern for rooms, or should exist both in rooms and at a higher level which can also control room-scenes. Back to a 3rd party app.

Because the converter from the Philips standard Hue socket to a candelabra socket is both unsightly and will not support chandeliers with multiple bulbs because of wattage limitations.

column11: Still the best smart lighting system out there

The app is below basic and doesn't function the way you would expect. Missing key elements like grouping bulbs - not every fixture takes only one bulb. If a fixture, such as a surface mounted ceiling fixture, requires two bulbs, you should be able to group the bulbs by fixture type so that you can adjust the lighting of the entire fixture. If you wish to further customize each bulb within that fixture, you should also be able to do so.  Creating rooms is only half a step.   You should also be able to change a fixture color's temperature with ease, and be able to make default color temperatures per fixture.   Location aware never stays on and therefore doesn't work.   There should be a quick way to turn lights on and off without having to go deep within the app. Being able to access via lock screen and notification would help. I have a Samsung S6 edge, so even being on the edge functions would help. The beauty of a normal light switch is that you can walk into a dark room and in a matter of seconds make it bright. Fumbling around your phone to turn on a light sets us back and makes the use of the fixture/app clunky - and a normal light fixture more desirable.

Add the ability to select lights that are a part of multiple rooms or the ability to choose individual lights for scenes. Basically you took away a ton of customization. I won't use this version until more flexibility is added back.

Thank you Philips this is a very nice upgrade.  It's taking a little time to learn the new app but I really like it.  Connecting seems faster and the app itself  responds quickly.  I have no complaints but I do have a request for consideration.  I have some of the white light bulbs in closets.  I would love to ability to set automatic timers so when I turn on my walk-in closet light via the wall switch, a countdown timer begins (say for 15 minutes) to turn the light off.  Maybe hitting the wall switch twice can be used to override the timer if desired.  Controlling your lights is great but sometimes you want them to control themselves.

column11: Great start on the new app
column12: Please allow lights to be in multiple 'rooms' i want an 'all' group and a 'Hallways' group which lights will also belong to other groupings. Also please add a sunset trigger routine without location requirement for vacation, etc.

Not impressed. A light can only belong to one room and a scene can only be applied to one room at a time. So if I want to set the whole apartment to a specific scene I either have to do a lot of tapping back and forth, or use a widget. But a widget can only contain four rooms and not everyone. Another option is to add all bulbs to one room, but that defeats the whole purpose of different rooms.
